item.title: Openings
item.description:
TIFR is a leading research institute with a focus on fundamental research, and provides various opportunities for collaborative projects. My group is interested in developing robust first-principles based quantum chemistry methods with a focus on understanding charge-accommodation and charge-transport problems. If you would like to be a part of the quantum chemistry team at TIFR, please consider the following options

Postdoctoral researcher: Highly motivated candidates are encouraged to apply for external funding sources such as the NPDF scheme, and TIFR Jawaharlal Nehru Post-doctoral Visiting Scientists Scheme. Prior experience in quantum chemistry method development and/or computational projects is desirable. If interested please send us an email with a CV and a one-page write up describing your research and interests.

Graduate student: TIFR has a robust graduate program and provides a unique environment for budding researchers. The selection to the program is via an annual entrance examination held in the month of December. For more details, please refer to the graduate program page.

Junior/Senior research fellow: We have an opening for a junior/senior research fellow. The project involves developing and/or applying quantum chemistry methods for understanding electron-structure of liquids with a focus on X-ray spectroscopy (XPS, XES and XAS). If you are interested, please send me an email containing a one-page write-up describing your research background and interests. More details can be found here.
